alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hart, west central Anderson and southeastern Oconee Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Seneca, or 5 miles east of Tugaloo State Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reed Creek, Lake Hartwell, Fair Play, Townville and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
